title: Mysteries: Don Winslow’s ‘City on Fire’ Review
sub_head: Irish and Italian gangs go to war in a novel set on New England’s 1980s mean streets.
body:
Don Winslow’s latest combustible crime chronicle, “City on Fire,” takes place in Providence, R.I., in the 1980s. Here a crew of Irish crooks and a family of Italian criminals maintain a cooperative business arrangement; they conduct their affairs in the watchful shadow of Boston and New York syndicates who would love to take over their operations.
All is copacetic until one of the Italians shows up with a beautiful realtor from Connecticut, and one of the Irish makes a crude pass at her. What starts as a squabble becomes a violent clash, and then a war of opportunistic rivals.
